faqs.answer: Common cardiovascular disease symptoms include chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue, dizziness, and irregular heartbeat. In some cases, symptoms may be silent until a major episode like a heart attack.

faqs.answer: Diagnosis may include physical examinations, blood pressure checks, ECG, echocardiograms, stress tests, and blood work, depending on the patient's health history.
